newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash soymeal - Some basis values raised.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash soymeal - Some basis values raised.

text.p: Some soymeal basis offers were raised in reaction to a lower-than-expected weekly crush rate last week, U.S. cash dealers said.
The National Oilseed Processors Association on Thursday reported the weekly crush at 22.467 million bushels, below the 23.50 million to 24.90 million the trade expected.

The higher offers were offset by lower CBOT soymeal futures. Dealers said sales and buyer interest increased when CBOT July soymeal futures dropped under $280 per ton early Friday. The lower CBOT soymeal put many cash offers at less than $300 per ton, which was attractive to buyers.
Domestic markets have provided the best demand for soymeal, with moderate sales reported to the poultry industry in the southeast, they said.
